intro: Lepidagathis thorelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a low, compact rosette. It prefers moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for indoor cultivation. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to bloom throughout the year under optimal conditions.
